org.jerkar.tool

Class JkBuildDependencySupport

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jerkar.tool.JkBuild
      • org.jerkar.tool.JkBuildDependencySupport
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    JkJavaBuild

    public class JkBuildDependencySupport
extends JkBuild
    Template build definition class providing support for managing dependencies and multi-projects.

    • Field Detail

      • STD_LIB_PATH

        protected static final java.lang.String STD_LIB_PATH
        Default path for the non managed dependencies. This path is relative to JkBuild.baseDir().
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • version

        protected java.lang.String version
        Version to inject to this build. If 'null' or blank than the version will be the one returned by #version()

    • Constructor Detail

      • JkBuildDependencySupport

        protected JkBuildDependencySupport()
        Constructs a JkBuildDependencySupport

    • Method Detail

      • version

        protected JkVersion version()
        Override this method to define version programmatically. This is not necessary the effective version that will be used in end. Indeed version injected via Jerkar options takes precedence on this one.
        See Also:
        effectiveVersion()

      • effectiveVersion

        public final JkVersion effectiveVersion()
        Returns the effective version for this project. This value is used to name and publish artifacts. It may take format as 1.0-SNAPSHOT, trunk-SNAPSHOT, 1.2.3-rc1, 1.2.3. To get the effective version, this method looks in the following order :
        • The version injected by option (with command line argment -version=2.1 for example)
        • The version returned by the version() method
        • The the hard-coded trunk-SNAPSHOT value

      • moduleId

        public JkModuleId moduleId()
        Returns identifier for this project. This identifier is used to name generated artifacts and by dependency manager.

      • versionedModule

        protected final JkVersionedModule versionedModule()
        Returns moduleId along its version

      • downloadRepositories

        protected JkRepos downloadRepositories()
        Returns the download repositories where to retrieve artifacts. It has only a meaning in case of using managed dependencies.

      • publishRepositories

        protected JkPublishRepos publishRepositories()
        Returns the repositories where are published artifacts. By default it takes the repository defined in options repo.publish.url, repo.publish.username and repo.publish.password.

        You can select another repository defined in option by setting repo.publishname option. So if you want to select the repository defined as repo.myRepo.url in your options, set option repo.publishname=myRepo.

        If no such repo are defined in options, it takes JkRepo#mavenPublishLocal() as fallback.

      • depsFor

        public final JkPath depsFor(JkScope... scopes)
        Returns the resolved dependencies for the given scope. Depending on the passed options, it may be augmented with extra-libs mentioned in options extraXxxxPath.

      • versionProvider

        protected JkVersionProvider versionProvider()
        On JkBuild.asDependency(File...) method, you may have declared dependency without mentioning the version (unspecified version) or specifying a dynamic one (as 1.4+). The dependencyResolver() will use the version provided by this method in order to replace unspecified or dynamic versions.

      • dependencyExclusions

        protected JkDependencyExclusions dependencyExclusions()
        Specify transitive dependencies to exclude when using certain dependencies.

      • dependencies

        protected JkDependencies dependencies()
        Returns the dependencies of this project. By default it is empty.

      • defaultScope

        protected JkScope defaultScope()
        The scope that will be used when a dependency has been declared without scope. It can be returns null, meaning that when no scope is mentioned then the dependency is always available.

      • implicitDependencies

        protected JkDependencies implicitDependencies()
        Returns the dependencies that does not need to be explicitly declared. For example, it can include all jar file located under build/libs directory.

        Normally you don't need to override this method.

      • dependencyResolver

        public final JkDependencyResolver dependencyResolver()
        Returns the dependency resolver for this build.

      • dependencyTree

        public final void dependencyTree()
        Display the dependency tree on the console

      • scopeMapping

        protected JkScopeMapping scopeMapping()
        Returns the scope mapping used by the underlying dependency manager.

      • publisher

        protected JkPublisher publisher()
        Returns the publisher used to actually publish artifacts.

      • scaffolder

        protected JkScaffolder scaffolder()
        Description copied from class: JkBuild
        Returns the scaffolder object in charge of doing the scaffolding for this build. Override this method if you write a template class that need to do custom action for scaffolding.
        Overrides:
        scaffolder in class JkBuild

      • pgp

        public JkPgp pgp()
        Returns the PGP signer used to sign produced artifacts.

      • repoFromOptions

        public static JkRepo repoFromOptions(java.lang.String repoName)
        Creates JkRepo form Jerkar options. the specified repository name will be turned to repo.[repoName].url, repo.[repoName].username and repo.[repoName].password options for creating according repository.

      • reposFromOptions

        public static JkRepos reposFromOptions(java.lang.String repoName)
        Creates JkRepos from Jerkar options. The specified repository name will be turned to repo.[repoName].url, repo.[repoName].username and repo.[repoName].password options for creating according repository. You can specify severals urls by using comma separation in repo.[repoName].url option value but credential will remain the same for all returned repositories.

      • mavenPublishLocal

        public static JkRepo mavenPublishLocal()
        Returns the Maven repository located in Jerkar user Home. You can use it to "deploy" locally.
